result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Lehouillier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia unless prescribed to you by a licensed health care provider.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

Defendant Michael J Lehouillier in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Michael J Lehouillier in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 14CF149,14CF347 and 14CF356. 
PSI discussed. Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the Court. 
Court relates and orders: 

14CF149: 
3 years Prison 
1 yr 6 mo initial confinement 
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance abuse program.66 days credit. 
Dodge as Reception Facility. 
1 yr 6 mo extended supervision 
  Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
  Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia unless prescribed to you by a licensed health care provider. 
  Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
  Costs.

14CF347 and 14CF356: 
6 months jail. Credit for 66 days. Concurrant on all cases (14CF149, 14CF347 and 14CF356).  
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Costs

JAIL FAXED. 

Voters Rights and Felony Admonitions given.
